Articles.Content:
Another forum game, because we don't have enough

This game is simple: There is a person named Joe Smith who is on a magical quest, and he often comes to crossroads, defined by the user above

User 1: Joe chooses to exist. Joe comes to a road going right or left, should he go right, or left? Right: Sunny and Nice, Left: Dark and Scary

User 2: Joe chooses to go right because he is a wimp, however he encounters a monster. Should he fight or flee?

Also, please no killing Joe, unless you put him in magical heaven because it's part of his quest or something

Edit: Oh and Kristina and Jainina are apparently characters now

 

Joe decides to start his quest, however soon he comes across an internet troll hiding in his cave. The internet troll begs Joe not to take a picture of him, because that might ruin his secret identity. He threatens Joe with a meme battle. Should Joe take the picture and play a meme battle, or should he leave the troll alone?

Edited June 15, 2017 by LazySoUseHyperedit

Joe leaves troll alone because he knows that trolls are nowhere a good rival for a meme battle.

However as he leaves the cave, he discovers a ROCK on his way.

What should he do?
Joe enjoys the rock music for a while. Then he has to choose between popcorn and hotdog. Dog is angry, corn is spiky.

He chooses popcorn because he has his knight suit to protect him from spikes. Afterwards he realizes the corn was poison, which explains why it was spiked. Should he seek help or try to make an antidote out of nearby plants?

Yes 

he then goes to nowhere what happens next

Edited June 7, 2017 by kerbinorbiter

Once arriving to the town of Nowhere, he is greeted by a team of bandits who knocked him out with a shock baton. He is put in a dark room. When Joe regains conciousness, he finds himself left alone in the room, tied up with carbon ropes in a silver throne. He sees a knife nearby that could cut carbon ropes, but it is quite too far away to reach. Then he remembered that he knows escapology. As another option, he can jut wait till he gets interrogated.

What does he do next, escape or wait?

Edited June 7, 2017 by Joseph Kerman

Joe chooses to escape.
He closes his eyes, relaxes and tries to imagine himself in a fantasy land. Escapism is what he is strong in.

A door opens and bandit's cook is going to come in, but then stops when somebody calls him from corridor.
Will a gypsum statue above the door fall on his head, or no?

no

Joe finds some gold plates (TOTALY NOT WHAT YOU THINK THEY ARE)

what does joe do next?

Using a toothstick (bandits had ignored it), Joe takes stone blocks from the nearest wall, builds a kiln and melts the golden plates, using the wooden furniture as fuel.
He makes a golden sword and helmet.

Will Joe hit or run?

Joe runs. He encounters an old woman in need of help on the way- however, she has food, that joe desperately needs

Does joe kill her and take her stuff, help her, or just keep going?

None of the above. He decides to converse with her, and manages to grab a case to solve. It is from a place in Lindenborough, where everyone has mysteriously disappeared.

Does he go to accept the case and go to Lindenborough, or does he decline and just say thanks?

He says thanks, bashes her head in and takes her stuff

Does he say sorry, or just keep going?

9 minutes ago, Kosmonaut said:

He says thanks, bashes her head in and takes her stuff

Does he say sorry, or just keep going?

Man, you are screwed.

I don't see where an apology fits in an area in which you purposefully hit her.

While the conscience keeps torturing Joe, he discovers what made to do such terrible thing.
The old woman had big teeth with tusks and gray tail, and her red eyes had three yellow pupils in each. Joe had intuitively feeled some danger.

He says sorry and keeps going.

Joe meets a dragon. It's right wing is blocked by a stone.
Will Joe release the poor animal?

Edited June 8, 2017 by kerbiloid

The dragon that he happened to encounter was a very rare species with large, powerful wings and a strong stature. Joe tamed the dragon right after rescuing it. He named it Jack. While flying for a bit, he disembarked and walked a while. As he was walking, he met a girl. What does he do next?

 

Turn to page 70 if he decides to meet her

Turn to page 67 if he walks past by her

Turn to page 100 if he kills her

Turn to page 144 if he makes a short hi-hello.
Joe goes to page 67, walking past by her. Not that he chose, but it,s hard to choose with a rope on the neck and a spear against the back. No choice at the moment.

Joe then decides to turn to page 70

he finds out that the woman's name is...

Edited June 8, 2017 by kerbinorbiter

Janina. A rather odd name for such an impressive young girl.

They walk to town, have dinner, and they decided to walk separate ways, hoping to meet again. Not having walked far, Janina was kidnapped. Joe had heard the commotion, and had to do something. He knew 3 types of martial arts, so he can retaliate. But then again, he can call 911, when his cell has no signal reception. He has to go to the nearest payphone, 400m away.

Does he:

 

1) Call 911 on the payphone

2) Rescue Janina

Rescue Janina 

they then proceed to go home (together)....

Edited June 8, 2017 by kerbinorbiter

... by the ambulance van where they've appeared together after Joe had tried to apply 3 martial arts known to him. Kidnappers called 911 from the payphone 400 m away because they had never seen anything si funny. Now they have to choose: stay at home or go to the doctor.

= such funny

Joe decides to stay at home, but his wounds get infected, causing Joe and his wife to become green-skinned mutants with super strength. They stop many crimes and save many lives, but one day the must choose between letting a poor man who stole food for his family walk free or imprisoning him in the name of the law.

 

What do they do?

They decide to let him go. He gives them a piece of the stolen food to thank them. They eat the bread and feel better. The mildew covering the bread, works as antibiotics and breaks the fever. They find themselves in Janina's home, not mutant, sitting near the empty cooler with pieces of mildewed bread.

Now they decide where to get money and buy some pizza

As Joe was walking, he is greeted by an agent who offers him a high-cash contract involving a large case that involves the town of Nowhere. There are people being robbed there and the thieves hadn't been caught. The thieves are so good that they never leave clues, at least not obvious ones. He will recieve a badge, honor, and $100,000 if he cracks it. Does he accept, or decline?

Joe completely lost a clue on what is going on.

Joe has an existential crisis.

Should Joe cry or just be very sad?

He cries and is very sad at the same time

He then realizes he was crippling depression

Should he seek help or try to solve the $100,000 case while depressed?
